summary: Brucellosis is endemic to the Mediterranean basin, the Persian gulf, India, Mexico, and south America. it is caused by brucellosis, a small, slow growing, intracellular Gram-negative coccobacillus. it is transmitted to humans by direct contact with infected animals or intake of contaminated raw animal products, such as unpasteurized milk. blood pressure 138/92 mmHg, pulse rate 84 beats per minute, respiratory rate 18 breaths per minute, and body temperature 39° C. the patient had recently undergone subgingival curettage. an MRI of the spine was also performed to evaluate the patient’s back pain. the patient reported attending barbeque parties that served sheep meat every 2-3 weeks during his 6-month stay in Iraq. the patient denied other contact with animals while in Iraq. we began treatment with ceftriaxone (2 g/day) and vancomycin (45 mg/kg/day) a 99.6% equivalence was found with several subspecies of Brucella. the Brucella subspecies were confirmed as B. melitensis by sequencing the omp31 gene. the spread of brucellosis is attributed to increasing travel between affected countries. the first case of brucellosis in Korea was reported in 2002. there were only 7 cases of brucellosis diagnosed in 2016. edward et al.
